DOC.brief_title: Dexmedetomidine v Propofol TIVA ( Total Intravenous Anesthesia ) Interscalene Block
DOC.detailed_description: The anesthesia provide shoulder surgery commonly use combination regional intravenous ( IV ) anesthetic medication . The current drug choice IV sedation Propofol . Although . good anesthetic , incidence intermittent apnea make use problematic case head patient less accessible anesthesiologist , sit beach char position . Dexmedetomidine FDA approve drug , stable cardiovascular respiratory profile . It successfully use Neurological Vascular case Intensive care unit . The primary objective present study use Dexmedetomidine sedation , compare outcome Propofol sedation . The investigator ' enroll 50 patient study . Using computer program participant randomize two equal group receive either Dexmedetomidine Propofol . The standard hospital procedure call patient undergo Interscalene block ultrasound without nerve stimulation guidance prior go operate room ( OR ) . The block utilize 40 ml mixture 0.5 % Ropivacaine Lidocaine 1.5 % . At time patient receives preliminary sedation Midazolam 1mg IV Fentanyl 50 mcg IV . The participant brought OR prolong sedation initiate , randomly use either Dexmedetomidine Propofol . Dexmedetomidine infusion initiate bolus 1 mcg/kg give 10 min patient position , sedation maintain Dexmedetomidine 0.7- 1.0 mcg/kg/hr surgery . Propofol infusion start 100mcg/kg/min , maintain Propofol 50-120mcg/kg/min , surgery . In group investigator record incidence respiratory depression/hypoxia , hemodynamic stability , frequency airway manipulation , cardiovascular effect , need anesthetic supplementation Dexmedetomidine , post anesthesia care unit ( PACU ) discharge time , need postoperative pain medication , post operative complication , like nausea/vomiting . Significant difference two group evaluate use unpaired t-test numerical variable , Chi-square test Z test categorical variable . The investigator hypothesis Dexmedetomidine cause few episode intermittent apnea , reduce need supplemental medication sedation , compare Propofol
